utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here’s a fun Postal fact. The inner side of our mailbox is under federal jurisdiction. So, if you broke my right thumb, that’s Pasadena city police. But if you broke my left thumb, that’s the FBI.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If I’m going to jail, I’m killing him, not breaking his thumb.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I got a letter from my Meemaw. Umm. Smell this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, roses, bengay, and Dr. Scholls’ foot powder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, Grandma by Calvin Klein. You know, the last time I got a hand written letter it was from someone who told me I parked like a blind person.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That someone has a name.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, thank you. Oh, Meemaw got a new set of teeth. Oh, but then she found her old ones. Oh, so now the new ones are just gonna be her church teeth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fun. Like your Comic-Con Spock ears and your around the house Spock ears.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I park fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness, she’s coming to visit!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, it’ll be nice to finally meet her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you are going to love her. She is the kindest, sweetest woman you’ll ever meet. Unless you’re a gopher digging up her vegetable garden. In that case, you can expect to have your head bashed in with a shovel.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her. That’s not her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? The old Asian man is not your Meemaw?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And that’s not helpful. You know, I got her an iPhone for Christmas. I’ll see where she is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s nice. Most people her age don’t embrace technology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, she doesn’t even know she has it. No, I had my sister slip it in her bag so that I can track her like a sea turtle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Same as when we lost you at the zoo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, for the hundredth time, I smelled kettle corn and couldn’t find the cart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Still doesn’t explain how you ended up on the freeway divider.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Moon Pie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Meemaw. I’m so happy to see you.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: I’m so happy to see you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. You got even smaller. I love it. Uh, Meemaw, this is Leonard. Leonard, this is my Meemaw.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi. So nice to finally meet you. Let me take this for you, Meemaw.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Oh, no. Now you call her Constance. I call her Meemaw. You have your own Meemaw. It’s not my fault she died when you were four.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Is that nice to say to your friend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It isn’t, Meemaw. Sorry, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you please live with us forever?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. If you had a superpower, and spent your whole life being told to suppress it, when you finally decide to embrace that power, why hide in isolation?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry, and how much money did your version of Frozen make?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m just saying, instead of Let it Go, she should really sing, Look At Me Hiding in a Freezer Like a Dove Bar.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She built an ice castle, made a snow monster and gave herself a complete makeover in one day. You know what I saw you do today? Eat a block of cream cheese straight from the foil and lie about it to your wife.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Sorry for eavesdropping, but did you know they actually had the song Let It Go in place before they finalized the story?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s true. In fact, they liked the song so much, they retooled the whole script around it.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Which is probably why that movie sucks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here we are talking about Frozen, and yet, you got burned.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m so sorry but, how can you not like that movie?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I just think it gets more credit than it deserves.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s what I said an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Wow. You’ve been talking about Frozen for an hour?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You should’ve seen us after The Good Dinosaur.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was a classic western set in the post-Jurassic period, and it changed my life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you comfortable?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Very. It’s nice to rest after 800 flights of stairs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You were so cute, huffin’ and puffin’. There’s Amy. I just know you’re gonna hit it off. You both have the same fashion sense. Hello. Come in, say hi to my Meemaw.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi. Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How was your trip?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Wonderful. And the pilot did such a good job, I gave him a butterscotch.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s great. And look at you, sitting in Sheldon’s spot. You know, I don’t even get to sit there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. And you never will. Ooh, hey, oh, ask her to do the tissue thing. Do it, ask her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can I have a tissue?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Isn’t that the best? She’s like Grandma Spider-Man.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: He’s been saying that since he was little. I still don’t know what it means.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, well, you two sit down and get to know each other. I’ll get your room ready.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Oh, now don’t you go looking through my suitcase for presents.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I did, would I find any?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Maybe. But you also might find my brassieres and bloomers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a risk I’m willing to take.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, this is so nice. He’s so excited to have you here and…

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Okay, now let’s you and me get something straight. He may think that I came to bake him cookies, but the real reason is to size you up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: S, s, si, size me up?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Sheldon’s mother may be okay with you, but I’m not so easy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I, I’m, I’m sure you’ll like me once you get to know me.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Oh, you better hope so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A Texas Special cattle and calf car train set with authentic horn and bell. Thank you, Meemaw.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome, Moon Pie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, why don’t you look excited? Well, you get to watch me play with this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I see you’re reading Saga.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Yeah, I hear it’s pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It is, and not a lot of comics have a woman with wings breastfeeding a baby right on the cover.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I’ll take your word for it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You should. He’s really looked.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m Raj, by the way. This is Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Claire.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I’ve never seen you here before, Claire.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: It’s my first time. I’m looking for inspiration for this movie I’m writing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re a screenwriter?

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Well, screenwriter, slash bartender, slash, a month away from living in my car.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I get that. I’m a scientist, slash party planner, slash small-dog enthusiast, slash guy who probably should have stopped at scientist.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: You’re really a scientist?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, astrophysicist.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: That’s perfect. Do you think I could pick your brain for my movie some time? It’s animated sci-fi for kids.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure. I love animated movies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He does, and he has the Lilo _ Stitch collector plates to prove it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me for wanting a little magic in my life.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Here’s my number. Give me a call, we’ll get together.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, great.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: See ya.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, bye.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing? You have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, how do you think she’d feel about you helping a beautiful girl with her screenplay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I wouldn’t say she’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? You don’t think she’s attractive?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I do. I just wouldn’t tell my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Constance, are you sure I can’t pour you some wine?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Oh, no wine for me. Sheldon’s bringing me my whiskey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here you go, Meemaw. I made it just how you like, a lot in a glass.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Thank you, Moon Pie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m curious. Why do you call Sheldon Moon Pie?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: ‘Cause he’s so nummy-nummy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Penny
utterance.content: She could just eat him up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I call her Meemaw because, well, just, well, look at her.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: It’s interesting that Leonard and Penny know about his nickname and you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, well, you know, now, now that I’m hearing it, it does sound familiar.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How could it? I never told you, and you never bothered to ask.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, now I know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: So, Penny, I understand you have a new job.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. I’m a pharmaceutical sales rep.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Oh. It’s so wonderful that you modern gals can have it all. A husband and a full-time career.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I have a relationship and a full-time career, too.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: That doesn’t bode well.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not? You, you just said it’s okay for her to work.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Well, Leonard doesn’t need as much tending to as Sheldon does. And as Moon Pie explained, Leonard’s work is more of a hobby.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s my best friend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Look, I, I get that you’re protective of your grandson, but he’s an adult now. Maybe I understand what he needs better than you do.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: I appreciate your honesty, dear.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: And here’s some more honesty. I don’t like you very much.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, maybe I don’t like you either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. You have to like each other. Well, we have a 4:30 reservation at Applebee’s.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think I should leave.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But why? Other than you two fighting, we’re having such a good time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The minute you left the room, your precious meemaw started giving me a really hard time. I don’t need this.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Let her go. And under no circumstance will you give her that engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What ring?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe we should give them some privacy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. You go ahead. I’ll catch up with you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You have an engagement ring?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny, did you know about this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: When did you get an engagement ring?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mother gave it to me, and I had been thinking about giving it to you, but then we broke up.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Well, thank goodness for that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, will you please tell your grandmother to stay out of this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think I could do that.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Sheldon, tell this girl that my ring will never be on her finger.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m gonna opt out of that one, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who said I even want to be engaged to him? And if I do, I, I don’t need your hand-me-downs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, all right, look, l, let’s all, let’s remain calm and analyse this situation. Now, I realize that you’ve only known each other for less than a day, but is it possible this crankiness is because your cycles have synced?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: You leave the room and let the grown-ups talk. Now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t speak to him like he’s a child.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. I’m gonna go next door and play with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, so you met this girl, you exchanged numbers, and you’re gonna meet up with her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just to help her with her screenplay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I guess that’s not so bad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You weren’t there. He was really flirting.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, it’s not my fault if American women project their fantasies on foreigners with the kind of magical voice that grants wishes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m sure it was harmless. People flirt. No big deal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? So it’s okay if I fl…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not you. I own your ass. The real question is, where are you with Emily?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, it’s hard to say. I think we’re good, but things like this make me wonder if Emily’s really the right person for me. I mean, did you guys ever have doubts about each other?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Never.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, you forget how much of our early dates involved you doing magic and me doing this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. I had reservations about you, too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t matter now, ’cause I love how things worked out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Me, too. And I think you’re even more beautiful than this rose.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. You know, the last time I saw my grandma, the most exciting thing was watching the ash of her cigarette get longer and wondering if it was gonna fall in her pudding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, right in there. She ate it and everything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. What happened? Is Amy gone?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. They asked me to leave so they could speak privately.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. It was quite tense. So here’s the million dollar question, uh, who wants to pop over there and get my trains?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right. I’ve made up my mind. I’m gonna do the right thing, call this girl, and let her know that I’m in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, so far we’ve heard, made up my mind I’m dumping Emily.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Made up my mind to date both of them by pretending to be twin brothers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And made up my mind, I’ll ask for a threesome and if they say no, play it off as a joke.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m calling her. And the threesome didn’t deserve the belly laugh it got.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re right. It could totally happen.

utterance.speaker: Claire (voice)
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hi. Hi. Yeah, it’s Raj. Rajesh. We met at the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up? Figure out what time you’re free?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, that’s why I’m calling. I, um, I just, I need to let you know that I have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Okay. Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, no, no. I, I didn’t want to mislead you after you asked me out.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: I didn’t ask you out. I just need help with my screenplay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, are you saying that we didn’t have a vibe?

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Why do you care if we have a vibe? You have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, I just told you I had a girlfriend. The least you can do is tell me if we had a vibe.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Sure, we had a vibe.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I knew it. Okay, we did have a vibe. This is exciting. What’s my next move?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You still have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Right. Good catch. Anyway, so I’m sorry to waste your time. And, uh, and good luck with your screenplay.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Hang on. We’re both adults. We can still get together without it meaning anything.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not me. Ever since you admitted we had a vibe, I’ve been planning our wedding.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Look, it’s just coffee. I’ll ask you some questions about science, and if you propose, I promise to say no.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. That hurts a little, but okay.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Great. I’ll text you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bye. All right. So, uh, we’re meeting for coffee like two adults. Everybody’s happy. Easy peasy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you gonna tell Emily?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. We have no secrets.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When are you gonna tell Emily?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He lied about the cream cheese. He ate the whole thing. I saw him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Look, I know you think I’m not right for Sheldon, but trust me, I’m his best shot. You have no idea how much I put up with.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: I know more than you think I do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? You know what it’s like to have date night ruined because Google changed their font?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Young lady, if you think I don’t know what it’s like to live with a stubborn, egotistical man, then you’re wrong. ‘Cause that was my husband.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: There were days I wanted to fill his pockets with corn and toss him in the pigpen.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, if you understand, then why are you giving me such a hard time?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Because when you broke up with Sheldon, it hurt him deeply, and I don’t want to see that happen again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. Sorry. Sheldon would like to say something to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just get in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Meemaw, look, I’m sorry, but I have to defend my girlfriend to you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, great, now you’re gonna get emotional. I always looked up to you and Pop-Pop. I, I know what a challenging man he could be, but I saw you stand by him and-and make him into a better person.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that is exactly what I’ve been doing the last five years with this little work in progress.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He never disappoints, does he?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think what Sheldon means to say is we’ve both grown together. Isn’t that right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Say yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: Fine. If you feel so strongly, I won’t stand in your way.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So if he wanted to give me that engagement ring, we would have your blessing?

utterance.speaker: Meemaw
utterance.content: I suppose.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just gave you my virginity, woman. Cool your jets.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, see, if you just change the story to the destruction of our galaxy, then a super massive black hole could work.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: This is great. Thank you so much. I just got to figure out a way for everyone to die that isn’t too scary for children.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And that’s how Mommy and Daddy met.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Hey, did you ever tell Emily about us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will.
